curam.core.impl

Class SearchServiceConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.core.impl.SearchServiceConnector

  • public final class SearchServiceConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to connect to the search server, whether from the Curam application to perform searches or from the startup build target to initialize the server. This class deals with the logistics of whether we are runnng in RMI mode, with IBM WebSphere, BEA WebLogic, or SAP Netweaver. Its essential function is to look up the EJBMethod bean of the SearchServer and invoke methods on it. The lookup uses JNDI and methods are invoked using RMI.

    • Method Detail

      • search

        public static SearchServerResults search(CuramQuery query)
                                  throws AppRuntimeException
        This method invokes the search on the supplied query. It connects to the server using the credentials of the current user.
        Parameters:
        query - a correctly formatted Curam query object
        Returns:
        search results
        Throws:
        AppRuntimeException - (GSSSEARCHSERVER.ERR_SEARCH_SERVICE_LOGIN) if login credentials supplied are rejected by the search server.
        AppRuntimeException - (GSSSEARCHSERVER.ERR_SEARCH_SERVICE_CONNECT) if a connect error, create error, or naming error are caught connecting to the search server - stack traces are printed to the log.

      • setTestMode

        public static void setTestMode()
        Used when setting up a unit test. When test mode is set the search service connector will use a local index to run unit tests. Not for use in production.

      • doTestStartup

        public static void doTestStartup()
                          throws AppException,
                                 InformationalException
        Initialise search connector for use with unit tests. Only for unit testing, this should not be used in production systems.
        Throws:
        AppException - TODO: JavaDoc.
        InformationalException - TODO: JavaDoc.
